pictures.name: Quakers and tobacco planters in Barbados
pictures.caption: English quakers and tobacco planters in Barbados. Pieter vander Aa, Les Forces de l'Europe, Asie, Afrique et Amerique, 1726.

Sketch of a flag taken from rebels against slavery in Barbados, after the uprising known as Bussa's Rebellion. The flag appears to stress the rebels' loyalty to Britain and to the Crown while conveying their earnest desire for liberty. British forces on Barbados suppressed the revolt and hundreds of the rebels were killed.
pictures.name: Sketch of a flag used by the Bussa rebels

pictures.caption: An extremely attractive example of Bellin's rare 1758 map of Saint Lucia (St. Lucia) or Sainte Lucie in the West Indies. St. Lucia is considered to be one of the most beautiful of the Windward Isles. This map covers this spectacular Caribbean island in considerable detail showing mountains, cities, and forests in Bellin's distinctive profile style. Good harbors are marked with miniature anchors. A decorative rococo style title cartouche appears in the upper left quadrant. Drafted in 1758 by Jacques-Nicolas Bellin for publication in Provost's c. 1760 edition of L`Histoire Generale des Voyages .
pictures.name: A 1758 map of Saint Lucia

pictures.caption: A 1776 map of the Caribbean isle of Saint Vincent. The southern portion of the island was under British control, and the northern portion was under the control of the Black Caribs.
pictures.name: Map of Saint Vincent
Kingstown, St. Vincent, 1890s
pictures.caption: Fort Duvernette and Young's Island from Calliaqua, St. Vincent, 1890s

Bunkers Hill, Richmond Estate, Saint Vincent. May 30, 1902 This ridge, near the Wallibou river, shows the dendritic drainage system gradually creeping to crest of the ridge. Material along crest is fine dust, which rains formed into a cement-like coat.
pictures.name: Bunkers Hill, Richmond Estate, Saint Vincent after eruption of La Soufriere
Barrouallie, tent camp for people displaced by the 1902 eruption of the Soufrière
pictures.caption: Group of tents and huts with hill behind. This is probably the camp for the refugees made homeless or evacuated during the 1902 eruptions. Small child in the foreground.
